Message.Msg: Fiscal 2013 Financial Guidance of Local Corp: Revenue - The company expects 2013 revenue of between $93 million and $95 million, which at the mid-point, is an increase of 12 percent, over the fourth quarter 2012 exit run rate. Adjusted Net Income – Adjusted Net Income for 2013 is expected to be at least $5 million, which would result in approximately $1 million in debt-free cash flow. The company defines debt-free cash flow as cash provided by operating activities, less capital expenditures

Message.Title: AMZN+LNKD+NFLX= $155 billion in market cap
Message.Msg: But when you add their earnings together you get no earnings. AMZN of course at $125 billion is the monster bubble, but LNKD at $20 billion and NFLX at $11 billion are jokes as well. What a market, we will see when they crumble, because they all will if they don't deliver the earnings. No matter how many times people claim earnings don't matter, they actually do, that is why you build a company.

This will be $100 by year end 2013. Anyone looking beyond the seasonally adjusted statistics would see what Amazon has to report... Even on an adjusted basis, category growth is slowing. On an unadjusted (real/raw data) it actually shrank MOM...
I thought so too but this GARBAGE IS STILL RED & I HAVE NO CLUE WHY.... I'm not taking PE or profit margin.... I'm talking day trade... Just MM complete control screwing call buyers...

Tech, your 100 target to me seems pretty drastic to be honest, if there is a market crash it will definately hit that. However market staying where it is, I think if they keep reporting #$%$ numbers like last year, it will see $170s.

Topic.Title: Lauches new kindle in Europe & JAPAN

Message.Msg: guess no one gives a #$%$

Kenji: The reason this rally is so out of control (market wide) is that we are approaching the end of the games. The Fed and financial sector players wrongly thought retail would be sheeple and come take everything if it was "safe" (low vol, managed seasonally adjusted NOMINAL growth). When you actually take a very hard look at non seasonally adjusted data over time and the incremental debt required to generate said "growth", you'll realize that time is running out. In reality, they never could succeed in this destructive gamble because the third order effects are dominating second order effects (because we played this game for so long that real competitiveness has been undermined by decades of systematic malinvestment in non value creating activity). We are past the event horizon. If the Fed did really cut government spending, the economy would go in a tailspin. Even as it reduces the rate of growth (a cut in common parlance), it contributes less to GDP and will make the "growth" headlines harder. Side note, I hope folks read the Harvard paper on HFT manipulation. It has already been pulled from the Harvard website, but you can get it elsewhere. I had downloaded a copy previously, so I can send it to people if so. I've always compared HFT to having radar where everyone else has only line of sight...

Message.Title: google pressure amazon into price cut
Message.Msg: The Nexus 7 tablet, priced at $199, was a direct competitor to Amazon's Kindle Fire. There was no if there. The pricing was the same, the size was the same, it's pretty obvious that Google launched this tablet to target Amazon's market. Obviously the tablet carries proper Android, with access to Google's entire ecosystem, contrary to Amazon. Since Amazon was supposedly pricing its Kindle Fire near breakeven, Google had to accept similar profitlessness to enter the segment at the same price point.

Got a couple of really big POMO days (not surprisingly OpEx is the biggest), so I expect the games to continue. Notice that volume is lower of low POMO days. Would love to see someone stock on aggrefate and SS names volume (particularly low float jam scams) as a function of Fed POMO $ in this "rally".

Message.Title: AMZN trading alert
Message.Msg: My peripheral trading system generated following trade signal before close today: “Exit Long AMZN to hold CASH at market close on 3/13/2013" Alert performance so far (since Feb 4th, 2013): -3.33%. See my previous posts for alert history.

The signal was generated before the trade time indicated in the alert statement. The signals can show up (rarely) before regular market open, (rarely) during regular trading hours, or (mostly) before regular market close.
I posted the results after extended trading was closed, for informational purposes only. It is recommended to stay Cash on earnings release dates.
